item.title: Tatiana Schlossberg’s Profile in Courage
item.description: Readers express sorrow about her cancer and dismay at her cousin’s actions as health secretary. Also: Revenge prosecutions; Mark Kelly; donors to universities.

item.title: How Is QAnon Reacting to the Epstein Files?
item.description: It has a little something to do with Donald Trump.

item.title: James Carville: Out With Woke. In With Rage.
item.description: Democrats also have to shed the last vestiges of woke.

item.title: How the Elite Behave When No One Is Watching: Inside the Epstein Emails
item.description: This power elite was already used to ignoring the powerless. Redeeming a disgraced sex offender was a logical next step.

item.title: Trump Falls Short of His Populist Rhetoric
item.description: The Trump administration is using its antitrust powers mostly to protect Mr. Trump.

item.title: Why Trump Won’t Face Prosecution This Time Around
item.description: The president has a very big immunity umbrella.

item.title: I Went to an Anti-Vaccine Conference. Medicine Is in Trouble.
item.description: A journey to the fringe of MAHA.

item.title: What Your Signature Dish Says About You
item.description: Like your astrological sign, what you bring says a lot about who you are.

item.title: Donate This Holiday Season: The Middle East Needs Your Help
item.description: This holiday season, I am donating to nonprofits that help make community ecosystems and nature’s ecosystems more resilient.

item.title: A.I. Dominates Our World. Why Don’t Democrats Have a Plan?
item.description: To stay relevant for 2028, the party needs to figure one out.

item.title: America’s Caregivers Are in Crisis
item.description: Caregivers are at the brink of despair.

item.title: The Incomprehensible March Toward Regime Change in Venezuela
item.description: The administration’s drug war rhetoric seems like a pretext. But a pretext for what?

item.title: 7 Experts on How to Actually End the War in Ukraine
item.description: The war in Ukraine has become a fateful conflict of Russia and the West.

item.title: The Outrageous False Equivalences That Prop Up President Trump
item.description: Aren’t his apologists exhausted by their moral calisthenics?

item.title: Yes, We Must Talk About Epstein
item.description: Readers strongly object to David Brooks’s argument that we should focus on more important issues. Also: Firings at the National Endowment for the Humanities.

item.title: How Can Anyone Seriously Doubt Meta Is a Monopoly?
item.description: All you need is common sense.

item.title: How to Use. A.I to Talk to Whales
item.description: This is not your average chatbot.

item.title: Listening to a Book Counts as Reading
item.description: We need to let go of our legacy print snobbery.

item.title: Cory Booker on What It Takes to Believe in America Again
item.description: “If America hasn’t broken your heart, you don’t love her enough,” the New Jersey senator argues.

item.title: The Boomers Are Protesting Trump. Where Is Gen Z?
item.description: The absence of young people from conventional protests is both a problem and a warning.

item.title: Cory Booker on What It Takes to Believe in America Again
item.description: “If America hasn’t broken your heart, you don’t love her enough,” the New Jersey senator argues.

item.title: America’s Housing Crisis, in One Chart
item.description: If we want more places for people to live, we’re going to have to get more creative.

item.title: Trump Has Put the Military in an Impossible Situation
item.description: Who should take responsibility for the president’s undeclared war in the Caribbean?

item.title: Trump Is Mired in a War of Attrition
item.description: It’s not a winning strategy.

item.title: In an Italian Masterpiece, Art and Faith Meet
item.description: Readers respond to a guest essay about the religious feelings inspired by Fra Angelico’s painting. Also: Down times at the movies.

item.title: We’re Seeing What a No-Immigration Economy Looks Like
item.description: Making America less hospitable to newcomers will eventually make our country poorer.

item.title: The Real Epstein Cover-Up
item.description: Once again, we see how far this country will go to maintain the power of men at the expense of women’s bodies.

item.title: Trump’s Proposed Ukraine ‘Deal’ Is a Disgrace
item.description: If Ukraine is forced to surrender to these terms, Thanksgiving will no longer be an American holiday but a Russian one.

item.title: Piggy Gets Polite
item.description: Trump, remarkably, finds a new low.

item.title: Donate This Holiday Season: Nicholas Kristof Needs Your Help
item.description: Each dollar you donate through my holiday guide will generate $4 to nonprofits that are making our world a better place.

item.title: Trump Says the Epstein Documents Will Hurt Democrats, Too. Maybe That’s a Good Thing.
item.description: “You need this renewal. You need new figures who are untouched, who were never part of these awful power games,” the columnist Lydia Polgreen argues.

item.title: Trump Faces a Lame-Duck Economy
item.description: There are no easy answers for the current economic discontent.

item.title: Don’t Miss This: Epstein Edition
item.description: The Epstein files are coming. But will Americans be able to fully trust them?

item.title: A Call to Purge Washington of Epstein’s Associates
item.description: The release of more Epstein files could take down many prominent men in Washington — both Republicans and Democrats. But for the columnist Lydia Polgreen, the purge is not a bad thing. “You need this renewal,” she says on this episode of “The Opinions.”

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein’s Victims Speak Out
item.description: On Tuesday, victims of the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein gathered to bring attention to the House vote to release the Epstein files. On this episode of “The Opinions,” the contributing Opinion writer Molly Jong-Fast describes the connection these women felt with one another and with their Republican advocate Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene. “They’re not faking it,” Jong-Fast says. “They had a real camaraderie.”

item.title: The Real Reason Trump Is Fawning Over Saudi Arabia’s Ruler
item.description: The story begins in the 1970s.

item.title: Remedies for the Burdens of Medical School
item.description: Readers respond to a guest essay proposing a shortened three-year course of study for aspiring doctors.

item.title: Epstein and the #MeToo of It All
item.description: “You need this renewal. You need new figures who are untouched, who were never part of these awful power games,” the columnist Lydia Polgreen argues.

item.title: Mamdani’s Surreal Meeting With Trump Is the Latest in a Pragmatic Month
item.description: Since his election, Zohran Mamdani has made some surprisingly pragmatic or traditional choices — including his surreal meeting with President Trump.

item.title: 2 Conservatives on Marjorie Taylor Greene, Trump and the G.O.P.
item.description: Thoughts on current and future of “a coalition uniquely built by Trump.”

item.title: What Trump’s Immigration Policies Are Doing to People Here Legally
item.description: Something new is happening in the breadth and ferocity of efforts to change the makeup of this country.

item.title: America Is Setting a Trap for Itself
item.description: The United States, not China, seems determined to upend the global order.

item.title: Don’t Push Russia’s Bad Deal on Ukraine
item.description: War and diplomacy: Readers react to developments on Russia and Ukraine. Also: A global democracy deficit; a sad phone.

item.title: Trump Promised Lower Prices. His Policies Are Raising Them.
item.description: From the day he took the oath of office, the president has pursued policies that are making life in America less affordable.

item.title: The Epstein Story? Count Me Out.
item.description: Conspiracy mongering about Epstein is making the progressive project impossible.

item.title: I’m in Venezuela. This Is the True Cost of Trump’s Gunboat Diplomacy.
item.description: Trump’s show of force toward Venezuela has created a disastrous political trap — for Venezuelans most of all.

item.title: Trump’s National Guard Blunder
item.description: A brief history of the National Guard in Washington.

item.title: Can the Right Confront Antisemitism in Its Ranks?
item.description: Why is it so hard for the right to draw a boundary at antisemitism in its coalition? According to Yoram Hazony, an Israeli political theorist, it’s because the group wasn’t prepared to navigate the “explosion” of antisemitism. In this week’s “Interesting Times,” he tells Ross Douthat how future leaders can have a bigger tent without giving people like Nick Fuentes “a seat at the table.”

item.title: Is the Gaza War Contributing to Antisemitism?
item.description: Is the recent onslaught of antisemitism on the right a result of the Israel-Hamas war? In this episode of “Interesting Times,” Yoram Hazony, an Israeli political theorist, explains how foreign policy is just one of the various forms that anti-Jewish messaging can take.

item.title: Trump’s Slip With the Saudi Crown Prince
item.description: Readers discuss what President Trump revealed in his meeting with the Saudi crown prince. Also: Albania’s A.I. “civil servant”; bullfighting as torture.
